entry.title: Just Flight Shares Development Update for F70/100 Professional for MSFS 20/24
entry.summary: Sim: FS24. Just Flight has released its latest development update for the upcoming F70/100 Professional for Microsoft Flight Simulator 2020 and 2024. The team reports significant progress since the last update and is nearing completion of the project. Along with the update, they have also shared a video trailer showcasing the new aircraft. Since the last development update, the team has refined, improved, and reworked various components of the AFCAS and FMS code. Additionally, the flight model has been enhanced further to better replicate the experience of flying the real aircraft, which real-world pilots have described as delightful to hand-fly. The sound developer has been diligently working on the aircraft, which will feature the highest number of individual sound samples he has ever included in a project. The team has stated that they will release a video providing a detailed overview of the sound features in due course. At the conclusion of the development update, the team mentioned that they are working hard to release the F70/100 Professional as soon as possible in 2026. â You can read the full development update on Just Flight's website.Â We will update you as soon as we have more information. â For the latest flight simulation news, remember to stay tuned on Threshold! â If you enjoy our content and want to support Threshold, consider joining us on Patreon!

entry.title: Just Flight Publishes A300B4 Development Update for MSFS 2020/2024
entry.summary: Sim: FS24. As part of their End of Year Round Up, Just Flight has shared some of the progress on the A300B4 Professional for Microsoft Flight Simulator 2020/2024, with its exterior artwork nearing completion and ready for showcasing. They have meticulously hand-placed thousands of rivets on every inch of the aircraftâs surface, with the tail area being the most obvious due to its housing of so many critical structures. Special attention has been paid to weathering, resulting in a representation of an airframe that has been in service for many years, complete with streaks of dirt, detritus, traces of rainwater, run-down panels, and more. The flight deck is no different, as they have previously shared. Just Flight considers their A300B4 to be one of the most accurately represented wide-body airliners in any flight simulator. A bold claim, as they note, but they will let the people be the judges. As for the remaining work on the art department, their artist is currently finishing the textures of the landing gear, wheels, and landing gear bays, before eventually focusing on the cargo hold interiors. Once that is out of the way, the artwork will be complete for the A300B4-203 variant. But the -203 isnât the only variant modeled, so thereâs still a bit more work to do: the showcased plane is actually an A300B4-103, for example. A freighter variant will also be included. With that being said, they are not ready yet to show any of the other planned variants. â After the texturing work is complete, they will move on to livery creation for the variants at hand, and they promise to provide a large selection of top-quality work that will represent the A300B4âs diverse range of operators from every habitable continent. â Furthermore, the developers have finally been able to share previews of the passenger cabin, modelled into a two-class layout from the 1980s, with the First Class cabin featuring 24 seats in a 2+2+2 configuration, and the economy cabin featuring 230 seats in a 2+4+2 configuration, narrowing at the rear to a 2+3+2 configuration. In line with their other products, the cabin will feature numerous simulated elements, offering âlots to play withâ during the cruise phase. The cabin artwork is deemed ready, but there may be minor changes between what has been showcased and the final product at the time of release, most notably related to cabin lighting, as it has not yet been implemented. The flight model is progressing decently, and the extensive data they sourced from a variety of A300B4 variants has been proven rather useful, allowing it to perform as faithfully as possible to the numbers. The systems have now been fully coded, and the plane is getting ready to enter wider beta testing. Among the most recently completed systems, they highlight the Carousel IV-A Inertial Navigation System and the autopilot logic. â Since they have something nearing completion, they can finally begin proper testing with their beta team, allowing them to delve deeply into the system's intricacies to cross-check their functionalities against the aircraftâs FCOM and mitigate any issues that may arise. â Just Flight will be sharing more details earlier next year. entry.title: Drzewiecki Design Releases Katowice Airport for MSFS 2020/2024
entry.summary: Sim: FS24. Drzewiecki Design has recently released their rendition of Katowice Wojciech Korfanty Airport (EPKT) for Microsoft Flight Simulator 2020 and 2024, serving the Katowice-Ostrava metropolitan area with a yearly average of 6.4 million passengers, making it the 4th busiest airport in Poland. It was originally built by the Luftwaffe in 1940, with three stone and concrete airstrips of varying lengths. It was used for handling military aircraft flying from Germany, carrying supplies to troops on the Eastern Front. It was also briefly used for aircraft testing in the final phase of World War 2. In 1945, the airfield was taken over by the Soviets, and it was subsequently handed over to Poland in the early 1950s, where it was used to house the Polish Air Forceâs 39th Fighter Regiment. A new runway was built in the mid-1960s, and regular scheduled passenger traffic began in 1966. Polandâs entry into the European Union has substantially accelerated the airportâs growth, with Wizz Air choosing Katowice as its first base outside Hungary. Other low-cost carriers followed suit within the next couple of years. A second terminal was built in 2007 specifically for Schengen flights, and an arrivals-only terminal (Terminal C) followed in 2015. That year also marked the construction of Katowiceâs new runway, which is 3200 meters in length (the second-longest runway in Poland). Itâs a focus city for ASL Airlines Ireland, Buzz (Ryanair), Electra Airways, Enter Air, LOT Polish Airlines, Lufthansa Cargo, Ryanair, Skyline Express, Smartwings Poland, and Wizz Air. Air Cairo, Air Dolomiti, Corendon Airlines, Freebird Airlines, Lufthansa, Nesma Airlines, Nouvelair, Pegasus Airlines, Plus Ultra, and Tailwind Airlines also serve it. The scenery features an accurate rendition of the airport, with custom ground textures, an up-to-date ground layout, a custom terminal interior, custom ground service equipment, an accurate runway profile, performance-friendly optimization, and much more. Itâs available on SimMarket for roughly $24.62, requiring at least 1.62 GB of free hard disk space to install. entry.title: Parallel 42 Releases ChasePlane for MSFS 2024
entry.summary: Sim: FS24. Parallel 42 has recently released their long-awaited physics-based camera system for Microsoft Flight Simulator 2024, providing realistic motion that dynamically responds to the environment, creating unparalleled immersion. For the unfamiliar, ChasePlane was originally released in 2016 for Microsoft Flight Simulator X, and later became compatible with Prepar3D, rapidly becoming the de facto camera application for ESP-based simulators at the time. After many years of waiting, Parallel 42 finally managed to break Asoboâs absurdly locked camera system, bringing ChasePlane to Microsoft Flight Simulator 2020 in early 2025, with the promise of eventually making it 2024 compatible, which has now been fulfilled. â The add-on features highly realistic physics-based camera behavior based on extensive research and real-world pilot footage. This warrants realistic motion that dynamically responds to the environment, embracing the flight model rather than altering it. Pilots can feel the vibration during the take-off roll, the rush of turbulence, and the fluid shifts during maneuvers. â ChasePlane 2020 owners can upgrade to 2024 for free by using the code âCPWENâ at the checkout page. â Itâs available in their store for $30.00. entry.title: iniBuilds Announces Liverpool John Lennon and Dallas Fort Worth Airports for MSFS24
entry.summary: Sim: FS24. In their most recent scenery development recap on their forums, iniBuilds has confirmed that they are working on renditions of Dallas Fort Worth International Airport (KDFW) and Liverpool John Lennon Airport (EGGP) for Microsoft Flight Simulator 2024. â Dallas Fort Worth International Airport (DFW) is one of the worldâs busiest airports by aircraft movement, and recreating the complexity and scale of the airport has been quite the task for the iniBuilds team. Development work has been underway for months, ranging from detailed ground poly work to getting the unique architecture of the terminals correct. Greg Jones, iniBuildsâ Head of Scenery and Geospatial Development, says that DFWâs size has been a challenge for the team to adapt their work flow integrating new features.Â âAdopting MSFS2024 as our core development platform gave us new opportunities to introduce levels of detail and quality previously not possible. â¦ Early in 2025, we had a commercial opportunity to work on Dallas Fort Worth. We jumped at the chance to produce what will be, by far, the largest project weâve ever doneâ, Jones explains. He expands on their goals for DFW, stating that they are putting âperformance at the core of everythingâ and â[The] testing team is hard at work ironing out any kinks, and so far the results have been stellarâ. As of writing, iniBuilds has not confirmed a release date for their rendition of DFW, but they say that users âshouldnât have to wait many more monthsâ for a release. â Following in the footsteps of their recent release of Manchester and Leeds Bradford v2, iniBuildsâ newest UK airport will be Liverpool John Lennon, an airport with a rich history and scenic approach over the river Mersey. entry.title: VueloSimple Releases Almaty International Airport for MSFS 2020/2024
entry.summary: Sim: FS24. VueloSimple has just released its version of Almaty International Airport (UAAA) for Microsoft Flight Simulator 2020 and 2024. Located in the largest city of Kazakhstan, Almaty, the airport serves almost 11.5 million passengers annually. The airport first opened its doors in 1935, initially serving smaller civil and military aircraft. The main terminal was built in 1973. In 1998, the runway was reconstructed and achieved CAT II certification, which elevated the airport's status to that of an international airport. A new terminal was completed in 2004, and a second runway opened in 2008, receiving CAT III certification. Most recently, Terminal 2 was inaugurated in 2024. Today, the airport serves a variety of airlines, including Air Astana, Pegasus Airlines, and SCAT Airlines, accommodating nearly 11.5 million passengers annually. The newly released scenery comes packed with features such as detailed 3D models, up-to-date airport layout, accurate night illumination, and much more. The newly released Almaty International Airport by VueloSimple is now available on Contrail for approximately $15.21. â For the latest flight simulation news, remember to stay tuned on Threshold! â If you enjoy our content and want to support Threshold, consider joining us on Patreon!

entry.title: TaiModels Releases Bozeman Yellowstone International Airport for MSFS 2020/2024
entry.summary: Sim: FS24. TaiModels has released its latest scenery add-on for Microsoft Flight Simulator 2020 and 2024, featuring Bozeman Yellowstone International Airport (KBZN). Located in Montana, this airport serves the city of Bozeman and annually welcomes over 2.6 million passengers. The airport opened in 1941 under the name Gallatin Field, although the first passengers did not arrive until 1942. By the end of the 1960s, the airport underwent several improvements, including a runway extension. It was not until 2011 that the airport was renamed to its current designation. That same year, the terminal was expanded. In 2012, the airport began allowing international flights. Recently, in 2024, a new expansion of the airport's infrastructure was announced. Today, the airport serves a variety of airlines, including American Airlines, Delta Air Lines, and United Airlines, providing a wide range of destinations. TaiModelsâ rendition of Bozeman Yellowstone International Airport comes with features such as PBR ground markings and textures, detailed terminal interiors, accurate airport lighting, taxiways, and aprons, and much more.
